level.heading: Board authorized to further restrict hours of operation.
level.text: At the time of initial application or renewal of any class of license, the Board may further limit the hours of sale and delivery for a particular applicant (1) based on the Board's findings of fact, conclusions of law, and order following a protest hearing, or (2) under the terms of a settlement agreement.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 25-123 and § 25-723.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-310 substituted "settlement agreement" for "voluntary agreement".

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary amendment of section, see § 2(aa) of the Omnibus Alcoholic Beverage Regulation Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-597, January 14, 2013, 60 DCR 1001).

For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2(aa) of the Omnibus Alcoholic Beverage Regulation Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-52, April 22, 2013, 60 DCR 6372, 20 DCSTAT 1388).
